definition: sufferings
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers

sentences.english: Because of the nature of impermanence within the clouds, the river suffered very much.
sentences.chinese: 云彩那变化无常的本性，可让小河受尽了苦头。

sentences.english: Looks like you and I ate some of the same dirt.
sentences.chinese: 托尼说，“看来你和我吃过同样的苦头。”

sentences.english: However, if we focus only on conservation, then people may suffer.
sentences.chinese: 然而，如果我们只关注保护，那人类就要吃苦头了。

sentences.english: Someone who doesn't observe traffic regulations will sweat.
sentences.chinese: 不遵守交通规则者必将要吃苦头。

sentences.english: For this he has bitter taste, be is to accumulate capital circle as soon as possible the dream of 7 younger brother.
sentences.chinese: 为此他吃尽苦头，为得是尽快积累资金圆七弟的梦。

sentences.english: Never toy with a woman's feelings, or it could be the worse for you!
sentences.chinese: 千万不要玩弄女人的感情，否则你会吃苦头的。

sentences.english: John picked a fight with Jack and came off worst.
sentences.chinese: 约翰寻衅和杰克打架，结果大吃苦头。

sentences.english: Those punks couldn’t bear the interrogation; a tad bitter taste of it just brought them all to confession.
sentences.chinese: 那些浑小子经不起讯问，吃了点苦头全都说了。

sentences.english: Our industry suffers through insufficient investment in research.
sentences.chinese: 我们的工业因研究投入不足而大吃苦头。

sentences.english: His family suffered a lot on his account.
sentences.chinese: 他全家为他吃了很多苦头。

sentences.english: The police had a difficult time, but they were also most amused.
sentences.chinese: 警察吃了不少苦头，但他们也乐坏了。

sentences.english: I'll make you suffer for this insolence.
sentences.chinese: 我会使你为这种傲慢态度而吃苦头。

sentences.english: I think I suffered from the pressure Louis van Gaal was under.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得范加尔承受的压力让我吃了苦头。

sentences.english: Excessive drinking and smoking will catch up with you.
sentences.chinese: 你过度抽烟喝酒将来要吃苦头的。

sentences.english: Mr. Marwaha, the San Francisco software engineer, learned that the hard way.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山的软件工程师维卡斯因此吃了苦头。

sentences.english: When the police catch the men who stole the oil paintings they'll make them smart for it!
sentences.chinese: 当警察抓到盗窃油画的贼时，会让他们吃苦头。

definition: to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers
hidden loss (finance)
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
pent-up unspoken grievances/suffering not willingly or possibly spoken of
sweet taste (of power, success etc)/benefit
to learn from experience (coll.)
see 吃閉門羹|吃闭门羹[chi1 bi4 men2 geng1]
physical pain/lit. skin and flesh suffer
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
lesson/moral/to chide sb/to lecture sb
to have an easy time/(feel) well
hard times
pent-up frustration/petty annoyances
lit. bitter fruit/fig. painful consequence
capital/assets/savings/nest egg/(fig.) reputation/laurels (to rest upon)/old edition of a book/(tree) trunk
feeling better/to be more at ease
